Horace John Knowles ( 22nd July 1884 - 21st August 1954 ) was an author and illustrator. He is remembered mostly for magical depictions of Fairyland in his magnum opus Peeps into Fairyland, as well as for his biblical illustrations. For his first two published books, Legends from Fairyland (1908) and Norse Fairy Tales (1910), he collaborated with his brother Reginald L. Knowles.
Knowles' style, similar to that of his brother, has often been described as Art Nouveau.
